column2: HTTP API design guide extracted from work on the Heroku Platform API

column5: message

Merge pull request #96 from jessieay/master

Add guidance on providing standard response types
Add object type def
Describe return values for each basic data type
Add to summary

Add guidance on providing standard response types

* Returning an empty array rather than `NULL` helps consumers avoid
conditionals.
* Duck types FTW
* Except for `NULL`, I guess
* This came up when I learned that Oj parses BigDecimals as Strings.
Seemed like bad API design to sometimes return a Number and sometimes
return a String but this idea had not been articulated in the HTTP
Design Guide.
fix fragment references for gitbook build error

Merge pull request #22 from TravisPaul/patch-1

Should "SSL" be replaced with "TLS"?

Should "SSL" be replaced with "TLS"?

It seems that it's pretty rare to actually use SSL these days. It may even be better to just to say "https".

Merge pull request #20 from jamesmanning/patch-1

remove quotes from "service_class"

remove quotes from "service_class"

Since the guidance for attribute names is to downcase and use underscores so that the attribute names can be used without quotes, this just changes the example given to show that behavior.

The quotes being present are still valid JSON / JavaScript, but since the guidance leads to attribute names that can be used without them, having the example not include the quotes shows the benefit.
Markdown-codify timestamp field names for consistency
